articles.headline: Fed Weighs Words About Its Next Move
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve stopped using words that suggest the next move for interest rates will be upward.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve stopped using words that suggest the next move for interest rates will be upward.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 21 — The Federal Reserve, implicitly acknowledging hints of trouble in the economy, edged away Wednesday from previous signals that its next move on interest rates would be up.

articles.headline: In Utah, an Opponent of the ‘Culture of Obedience’
articles.snippet: The mayor of Salt Lake City has become a national spokesman for the impeachment of President Bush.
articles.abstract: The mayor of Salt Lake City has become a national spokesman for the impeachment of President Bush.
articles.lead_paragraph: SALT LAKE CITY — Rocky Anderson may not be the most liberal mayor in America. But here in the most conservative state, he might as well be.

articles.headline: Italy Swapped 5 Jailed Taliban for a Hostage
articles.snippet: The deal appears to be the first time prisoners have been openly exchanged for a hostage in Afghanistan and Iraq.
articles.abstract: The deal appears to be the first time prisoners have been openly exchanged for a hostage in Afghanistan and Iraq.
articles.lead_paragraph: ROME, March 21 —An Italian journalist who was held hostage for 15 days by the Taliban in lawless southern Afghanistan was ransomed for five Taliban prisoners, the Italian government and Afghan officials confirmed Wednesday.

articles.headline: After ‘Sopranos,’ a Need for a Hit
articles.snippet: HBO’s chief executive is preparing for life after the “The Sopranos” with a cachet of new offerings.
articles.abstract: HBO’s chief executive is preparing for life after the “The Sopranos” with a cachet of new offerings.
articles.lead_paragraph: With a last burst of episodes starting April 8, “The Sopranos,” will exit the television arena for the final time, leaving millions of fans without their all-time favorite series, and a network, HBO, without its Hall of Fame performer.

articles.headline: China Scrambles for Stability as Its Workers Age
articles.snippet: The number of retirees in China will double between 2005 and 2015, threatening the underpinnings of the economy.
articles.abstract: The number of retirees in China will double between 2005 and 2015, threatening the underpinnings of the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI, March 19 — When she reached 50, the retirement age for many women here, Chen Rui, a career accountant, immediately did what millions of people of her generation have begun doing: she scrambled to find a new job.

articles.headline: Motorola Cuts Its Estimate of Earnings
articles.snippet: Facing sluggish profits, Motorola dropped its quarterly revenue forecast by a billion dollars and announced a management shake-up.
articles.abstract: Facing sluggish profits, Motorola dropped its quarterly revenue forecast by a billion dollars and announced a management shake-up.
articles.lead_paragraph: The business prospects of Motorola, the 78-year-old technology company, suddenly look as thin as the Razr, its popular mobile phone.

articles.headline: Illegal Worker, Troubled Citizen and Stolen Name
articles.snippet: Illegal immigrants have turned increasingly to bona fide documents, stolen or bought by traffickers from actual Americans.
articles.abstract: Illegal immigrants have turned increasingly to bona fide documents, stolen or bought by traffickers from actual Americans.
articles.lead_paragraph: MARSHALLTOWN, Iowa — The two women named Violeta Blanco have never met. But for a long time they shared not only a name, but the same birth date and the same Social Security number.

articles.headline: For Some Subprime Borrowers, Few Good Choices
articles.snippet: Lenders and the government are being urged to cushion the blow to troubled borrowers and find ways to enable them to remain in their homes.
articles.abstract: Lenders and the government are being urged to cushion the blow to troubled borrowers and find ways to enable them to remain in their homes.
articles.lead_paragraph: Myriam Philemond says she knew almost from the start that she and her husband could not afford the nearly $500,000 house they bought in South Boston more than a year ago.

articles.headline: Apple TV Has Landed
articles.snippet: Apple TV can connect your computer to your TV without wires — as long as you have a wide-screen TV.
articles.abstract: Apple TV can connect your computer to your TV without wires — as long as you have a wide-screen TV.
